Detailed Description

Include file for ttyproc library.

Function Documentation

int ttyproc_getfd_node (  serialent_t *  node,
u_int16_t  flags
) 
 

obtain a file descriptor from a passed node with open flags

Parameters:
node The node to be used for obtaining a file descriptor.
flags The flags that will be passed to open function call.

int ttyproc_getpath_node (  char *  dpath,
serialent_t *  node
) 
 

returns a found node path given a node in the linked list

Parameters:
dpath The string to read device node path into.
node The node to be used when obtaining path.
This should be used if parsing the linked list within a program. Using ttyproc_getpath_vpid can yield wierd results otherwise.

int ttyproc_getpath_vpid (  char *  dpath,
int  vid,
int  pid,
int  pnum
) 
 

use vendor and product ids to obtain a node path

Parameters:
dpath The string to read device node path into.
vid The vendor identifier of the usb serial device.
pid The product identifier of the usb serial device.
pnum The port number identifier. Typically set to 1 with most devices.

int ttyproc_init (   ) 
 

checks proc is mounted, and performs various startup tasks

This must be called first before doing anything else.

int ttyproc_scanlist (   ) 
 

frees current node list and re-scans usbserial data.

In the future, this might scan serial data as well.

Variable Documentation

serialent_t * begin
 

a pointer to beginning of list

This is a pointer used to assign the node used for parsing to a linked lists beginning.

Never try to assign this value - always use in assignment.

int totalents
 

total serial_entry nodes

This is a global variable used to keep count of current nodes comprising the linked list.
